title: Graph.hh doesn't expose non-const reference to Edges

content.raw:
# Prerequisites

* [X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Checked the Q&A board for common solutions: http://answers.gazebosim.org
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed.
    * Checked that there is not already an Ignition package that provides the described functionality: https://ignitionrobotics.org/libs

# Description 

The [Graph::VertexFromId function](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/src/e272f076f171fce6be704e822a65a4c0cbecd9d6/include/ignition/math/graph/Graph.hh?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#Graph.hh-609:622) has two versions that return a `const` and non-`const` reference to a Vertex. However there is only a `const` version of the [Graph::EdgeFromId function](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/src/e272f076f171fce6be704e822a65a4c0cbecd9d6/include/ignition/math/graph/Graph.hh?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#Graph.hh-674), which makes it hard to modify Edge Data().

Likewise, the [Graph::AdjacentsTo and Graph::AdjacentsFrom functions](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/src/e272f076f171fce6be704e822a65a4c0cbecd9d6/include/ignition/math/graph/Graph.hh?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#Graph.hh-291:383) return non-`const` references to the graph vertices, while the [Graph::IncidentsTo and Graph::IncidentsFrom functions](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/src/e272f076f171fce6be704e822a65a4c0cbecd9d6/include/ignition/math/graph/Graph.hh?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#Graph.hh-425:486) only return `const` references to the graph edges.

# Steps to Reproduce

* Apply the following patch to [GraphUndirected_TEST.cc](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/src/e272f076f171fce6be704e822a65a4c0cbecd9d6/src/graph/GraphUndirected_TEST.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default):

~~~
diff -r 8372d72d8cf0 src/graph/GraphUndirected_TEST.cc
--- a/src/graph/GraphUndirected_TEST.cc	Tue Feb 12 20:49:41 2019 +0000
+++ b/src/graph/GraphUndirected_TEST.cc	Fri Feb 15 17:44:21 2019 -0800
@@ -365,9 +365,10 @@
   // Change some content and verity it.
   e2.Data() = 5.0;
   e2.SetWeight(6.0);
-  auto edge = graph.EdgeFromId(e2.Id());
+  auto &edge = graph.EdgeFromId(e2.Id());
   EXPECT_DOUBLE_EQ(5.0, edge.Data());
   EXPECT_DOUBLE_EQ(6.0, edge.Weight());
+  edge.Data() = 7.0;
 
   // Check that the edges point to the right vertices.
   EXPECT_EQ(0u, e0.Vertices().first);
~~~

* Try to build and it will fail to compile.

**Expected behavior:**  

Compile successfully.

**Actual behavior:**

Fails to compile.

**Reproduces how often:** 

always

# Versions

5.0.0 and 6.0.0, Ubuntu

# Additional Information

Prerequisites

  • [X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    • Checked the Q&A board for common solutions: http://answers.gazebosim.org
    • Checked that your issue isn't already filed.
    • Checked that there is not already an Ignition package that provides the described functionality: https://ignitionrobotics.org/libs

Description

The Graph::VertexFromId function has two versions that return a const and non-const reference to a Vertex. However there is only a const version of the Graph::EdgeFromId function, which makes it hard to modify Edge Data().

Likewise, the Graph::AdjacentsTo and Graph::AdjacentsFrom functions return non-const references to the graph vertices, while the Graph::IncidentsTo and Graph::IncidentsFrom functions only return const references to the graph edges.

Steps to Reproduce

  • Apply the following patch to GraphUndirected_TEST.cc:
diff -r 8372d72d8cf0 src/graph/GraphUndirected_TEST.cc
--- a/src/graph/GraphUndirected_TEST.cc Tue Feb 12 20:49:41 2019 +0000
+++ b/src/graph/GraphUndirected_TEST.cc Fri Feb 15 17:44:21 2019 -0800
@@ -365,9 +365,10 @@
   // Change some content and verity it.
   e2.Data() = 5.0;
   e2.SetWeight(6.0);
-  auto edge = graph.EdgeFromId(e2.Id());
+  auto &edge = graph.EdgeFromId(e2.Id());
   EXPECT_DOUBLE_EQ(5.0, edge.Data());
   EXPECT_DOUBLE_EQ(6.0, edge.Weight());
+  edge.Data() = 7.0;

   // Check that the edges point to the right vertices.
   EXPECT_EQ(0u, e0.Vertices().first);
  • Try to build and it will fail to compile.

Expected behavior:

Compile successfully.

Actual behavior:

Fails to compile.

Reproduces how often:

always

Versions

5.0.0 and 6.0.0, Ubuntu

Additional Information
